questions.text: The aqueous outflow system includes various structures such as trabecular meshwork, Schlemm’s canal and collector channels. Which of the following statements is correct about this system?

options.label: A
options.text: Trabecular meshwork consists of four layers.

options.label: B
options.text: Corneoscleral meshwork forms the outermost portion of trabecular meshwork,

options.label: C
options.text: Uveal meshwork mainly offers normal resistance to the aqueous outflow.

options.label: D
options.text: Uveal meshwork extends from the iris root and ciliary body to the Schwalbe’s line.

questions.correct_answer: D. Uveal meshwork extends from the iris root and ciliary body to the Schwalbe’s line.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Uveal meshwork extends from the iris root and ciliary body to the Schwalbe’s line. The aqueous outflow system includes the trabecular meshwork, Schlemm’s canal, collector channels, aqueous veins, and the episcleral veins. The uveal meshwork is the innermost part of the trabecular meshwork and extends from the iris root and ciliary body to the Schwalbe’s line.

Highyeild:

Aqueous humour is produced from plasma by the ciliary epithelium of the ciliary body pars plicata, using a combination of active and passive secretion. Aqueous fluid flows from the posterior chamber via the pupil into the anterior chamber, from where it exits the eye via three routes : namely trabecular outflow, uveoscleral drainage, and the iris.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option A: Trabecular meshwork is a sieve-like structure through which aqueous humour leaves the eye. It consists of three layers, which from inside out are uveal meshwork, corneoscleral meshwork, and juxta canalicular meshwork. Option B: Corneoscleral meshwork forms the larger middle portion, which extends from the scleral spur to the lateral wall of the scleral sulcus. Option C: The juxtacanalicular (endothelial) meshwork of the trabecular meshwork mainly offers normal resistance to the aqueous outflow.

questions.text: The mean values for outflow facility and uveoscleral outflow (percentage of total aqueous outflow facility) in normal eyes, respectively, are:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

0.28 μL/min/mmHg, 10% to 50%. Outflow facility in normal eyes ranges from 0. 22 to 0.28 μL/min/mmHg and decreases with age, ocular surgery, and trauma. Patients with glaucoma often have decreased outflow facility. Estimates of the value of uveoscleral outflow as a percentage of total aqueous outflow facilities may actually vary, with some being as low as 10%, and some as high as 50%. Uveoscleral outflow is pressure-independent.

Highyeild:

Aqueous humour is produced from plasma by the ciliary epithelium of the ciliary body pars plicata, using a combination of active and passive secretion. Theaqueous outflow system includes the trabecular meshwork, Schlemm’s canal, collector channels, aqueous veins, and the episcleral veins. Theuveal meshwork is the innermost part of the trabecular meshwork and extends from the iris root and ciliary body to the Schwalbe’s line.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option A - 0.05 μ/min/mmHg., ≤ 2%. -this is not the correct option. Option B - 0.10 μL/min/mmHg, ≤ 5%. - this is not the correct option. Option D - 0.40 μL/min/mmHg, 5% to 10% - this is not the correct option.

Extraedge:

Aqueous fluid flows from the posterior chamber via the pupil into the anterior chamber, from where it exits the eye via three routes : namely trabecular outflow, uveoscleral drainage, and iris.

questions.text: The composition of aqueous solution is similar to that of plasma with a few exceptions. Compared with plasma, aqueous humour has an increased concentration of which one of these components?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ascorbate Compared with plasma, aqueous solutions are slightly hypertonic and acidic . Aqueous has a marked excess of ascorbate (15 times greater than that of arterial plasma) and a marked deficit of protein (0.2% in aqueous as compared to 7% in plasma)

Highyeild:

Aqueous humour is produced from plasma by the ciliary epithelium of the ciliary body pars plicata, using a combination of active and passive secretion. A high-protein filtrate passes out of fenestrated capillaries (ultrafiltration) into the stroma of the ciliary processes, from which active transport of solutes occurs across the dual-layered ciliary epithelium.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option A: Because of the blood aqueous barrier, the protein content of aqueous humour (5–16 mg%) is much less than that of plasma (6–7 gm%). Option C: It is composed of 99.9% water and 0.1 % solids. Option D: The composition of aqueous is similar to plasma except that it has: High concentrations of bicarbonate, ascorbate, pyruvate and lactate; and Low concentration of protein, urea and glucose.

Extraedge:

Differences between aqueous humor & plasma AQUEOUS PLASMA -Marked deficit of proteins 0.024 gm/dl 7.0 gm/dl -Marked excess of Ascorbate 1.06 micromol/ml 0.04 micromol/ml -Excess of Lactate 4.5 micromol/ml 1.9 micromol/ml -Excess of Chloride & certain amino acids

questions.text: Which of the nerve has the longest intracranial course?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

6th nerve Abducens nerve has the longest intracranial course of all cranial nerves. It begins at its nucleus in the dorsal pons and courses superiorly and then anteriorly before leaving the brainstem at the pontomedullary junction. Because it has the longest intracranial course, it is most vulnerable to palsies due to raised intracranial tension.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. 3rd Nerve: Oculomotor nerve Option: B. 4th nerve: Trochlear nerve: longest intradural course Option: D. 2nd nerve: Optic nerve:

questions.text: Aqueous humour is a clear tissue fluid that circulates through the anterior cavity of the eye. Which of the following statements about this fluid are correct?

options.label: A
options.text: It is produced from plasma by the ciliary epithelium of the pars plana.

options.label: B
options.text: Secretion is subject to the influence of the parasympathetic nervous system.

options.label: C
options.text: Aqueous flows from the anterior chamber via the pupil into the anterior chamber.

options.label: D
options.text: The enzymatic action of carbonic anhydrase is critical to its secretion.

questions.correct_answer: D. The enzymatic action of carbonic anhydrase is critical to its secretion.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

The enzymatic action of carbonic anhydrase is critical to its secretion. Enzymatic action is critical in the secretion and flow of aqueous humour; carbonic anhydrase is among those playing a key role.

Highyeild:

90% of the aqueous flows through the trabeculae into the Schlemm canal and then the episcleral veins . This is a bulk flow pressure-sensitive route, so that increasing IOP will increase outflow. 10% of the aqueous passes across the face of the ciliary body into the suprachoroidal space and is drained by the venous circulation in the ciliary body, choroid, and sclera.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Aqueous humour is produced from plasma by the ciliary epithelium of the ciliary body pars plicata, using a combination of active and passive secretion. A high-protein filtrate passes out of fenestrated capillaries (ultrafiltration) into the stroma of the ciliary processes, from which active transport of solutes occurs across the dual-layered ciliary epithelium. Option: B. Secretion is subject to the influence of the sympathetic nervous system , with opposing actions mediated by beta-2 receptors (increased secretion) and alpha-2 receptors (decreased secretion). Option: C. Aqueous fluid flows from the posterior chamber via the pupil into the anterior chamber, from where it exits the eye via three routes: namely trabecular outflow, uveoscleral drainage, and iris.

questions.text: Routes of aqueous outflow are shown in the given image. Which of the following statements is correct about the given image?

options.label: A
options.text: 90% of the aqueous flows through B

options.label: C
options.text: Aqueous humor flows through A into the Schlemm canal

options.label: D
options.text: C receives the most aqueous humor drainage

questions.correct_answer: C. Aqueous humor flows through A into the Schlemm canal
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Aqueous humor flows through A into the Schlemm canal The given image shows the different routes of aqueous outflow. (A) Trabecular; (B) Uveoscleral; (C) Iris Aqueous humour is produced from plasma by the ciliary epithelium of the ciliary body pars plicata, using a combination of active and passive secretion. A high-protein filtrate passes out of fenestrated capillaries (ultrafiltration) into the stroma of the ciliary processes, from which active transport of solutes occurs across the dual-layered ciliary epithelium. The osmotic gradient thereby established facilitates the passive flow of water into the posterior chamber. Secretion is subject to the influence of the sympathetic nervous system, with opposing actions mediated by beta-2 receptors (increased secretion) and alpha-2 receptors (decreased secretion). Enzymatic action is also critical; carbonic anhydrase is among those playing a key role.

Highyeild:

(A) Trabecular; (B) Uveoscleral; (C) Iri Aqueous fluid flows through the trabeculae into the Schlemm canal and then the episcleral veins.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. 90% of the aqueous flows through the trabeculae into the Schlemm canal and then the episcleral veins. This is a bulk flow pressure-sensitive route, so that increasing IOP will increase outflow. Option: C. 10% of the aqueous passes across the face of the ciliary body into the suprachoroidal space and is drained by the venous circulation in the ciliary body, choroid, and sclera. Option: D. Iris receives the least of the drainage.

questions.text: Aqueous fluid flows through the trabeculae into a mesh-like canal and then into the episcleral veins. Which of the following statements are incorrect about this canal?

options.label: A
options.text: The inner wall is lined by irregular spindle shaped endothelial cells

options.label: B
options.text: The outer wall is lined by smooth flat cells

options.label: C
options.text: Septa commonly divide the lumen into 7–8 channels

options.label: D
options.text: The described outflow route into the canal is a bulk flow pressure-sensitive route

questions.correct_answer: C. Septa commonly divide the lumen into 7–8 channels
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Septa commonly divide the lumen into 7–8 channels The description given in the above question is of Schlemm’s Canal. 90% of the aqueous flows through the trabeculae into the Schlemm canal and then the episcleral veins. The Schlemm canal is a circumferential channe l within the perilimbal sclera. Septa commonly divide the lumen into 2–4 channels .

Highyeild:

Aqueous humour is produced from plasma by the ciliary epithelium of the ciliary body pars plicata, using a combination of active and passive secretion. A high-protein filtrate passes out of fenestrated capillaries (ultrafiltration) into the stroma of the ciliary processes, from which active transport of solutes occurs across the dual-layered ciliary epithelium.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. The inner wall is lined by irregular spindle shaped endothelial cells containing infoldings (giant vacuoles) that are thought to convey aqueous via the formation of transcellular pores. Option: B. The outer wall is lined by smooth flat cells and contains the openings of collector channels, which leave the canal at oblique angles and connect directly or indirectly with episcleral veins. Option: D. 90% of the aqueous flows through the trabeculum into the Schlemm canal and then the episcleral veins. This is a bulk flow pressure-sensitive route so that increasing IOP will increase outflow

questions.text: Identify the structures depicted in the given Image from the normal anatomy of the outflow channels of aqueous humour and correctly label them to the given options. Select the correct answer from the given below ciode:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1-c, 2-e, 3-b, 4-f The normal anatomy of outflow channels for aqueous humour is shown in the given image. Aqueous fluid flows from the posterior chamber via the pupil into the AC, from where it exits the eye via three routes. Trabecular outflow (90%) : aqueous fluid flows through the trabeculum into the Schlemm canal and then the episcleral veins. This is a bulk flow pressure-sensitive route, so that increasing IOP will increase outflow. Uveoscleral drainage (10%) : aqueous fluid passes across the face of the ciliary body into the suprachoroidal space and is drained by the venous circulation in the ciliary body, choroid, and sclera. Iris: Some aqueous fluid also drain via the iris . But this amount is physiologically insignificant.

Highyeild:

Aqueous humour is produced from plasma by the ciliary epithelium of the ciliary body pars plicata, using a combination of active and passive secretion. A high-protein filtrate passes out of fenestrated capillaries (ultrafiltration) into the stroma of the ciliary processes, from which active transport of solutes occurs across the dual-layered ciliary epithelium.

Random:

Explanation for all options: - Labels for the given Image: (A) Uveal meshwork; (B) Corneoscleral meshwork; (C) Schwalbe line; (D) Schlemm canal; (E) Connector channels; (F) Longitudinal muscle of the ciliary body; (G) Scleral spur Therefore Option B,C, and D air incorrect matches.

Extraedge:

Aqueous fluid flows from the posterior chamber via the pupil into the anterior chamber, from where it exits the eye via three routes : namely trabecular outflow, uveoscleral drainage, and iris.

questions.text: Intraocular pressure (IOP) is determined by the balance between the rate of aqueous production and the rate of aqueous outflow. Which of the following statements is incorrect about intraocular pressure?

options.label: A
options.text: The upper range of normal for adults is 21 mmHg

options.label: B
options.text: The supine position leads to an increase in intraocular pressure.

options.label: C
options.text: The extent of glaucomatous damage is directly proportional to the likelihood of progressive visual field damage.

options.label: D
options.text: From a clinical point of view, the rate of aqueous formation is the most important factor.

questions.correct_answer: D. From a clinical point of view, the rate of aqueous formation is the most important factor.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

From a clinical point of view, the rate of aqueous formation is the most important factor. The intraocular pressure (IOP) refers to the pressure exerted by intraocular fluids on the coats of the eyeball. From a clinical point of view, resistance to aqueous outflow (drainage) is the most important factor.

Highyeild:

Aqueous humour is produced from plasma by the ciliary epithelium of the ciliary body pars plicata, using a combination of active and passive secretion. A high-protein filtrate passes out of fenestrated capillaries (ultrafiltration) into the stroma of the ciliary processes, from which active transport of solutes occurs across the dual-layered ciliary epithelium. The osmotic gradient thereby established facilitates the passive flow of water into the posterior chamber.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. The normal IOP varies between 10 and 21 mm of Hg (mean 16 + 2.5 mm of Hg) on applanation tonometry. The normal level of IOP is essentially maintained by a dynamic equilibrium between the formation and outflow of the aqueous humour. Option: B. The supine position leads to a rise in intraocular pressure. Option: C. Glaucomatous eyes exhibit greater than normal fluctuation, the extent of which is directly proportional to the likelihood of progressive visual field damage, and a single reading may therefore be misleading.

Extraedge:

Secretion is subject to the influence of the sympathetic nervous system , with opposing actions mediated by beta-2 receptors (increased secretion) and alpha-2 receptors (decreased secretion).

questions.text: Which of the following is the true statement regarding the corneal endothelium?

options.label: A
options.text: It consists of multiple layers of polygonal epithelial cells

options.label: B
options.text: The cell density of endothelium is around 5000 cells/mm2 in young adults

options.label: C
options.text: The loss of cells with age is compensated with multiplication of cells

options.label: D
options.text: The endothelial cells contain active pump mechanism which keeps cornea dehydrated

questions.correct_answer: D. The endothelial cells contain active pump mechanism which keeps cornea dehydrated
questions.explanation:
Solution:

The endothelial cells contain active pump mechanism which keeps cornea dehydrated The active pump mechanism in endothelial cells keeps the cornea dehydrated and thus transparent.

Highyeild:

The Endothelium is a monolayer of cells on the posterior corneal surface that transports water from the stroma into the anterior chamber . This movement of water counters a natural tendency for the stroma to swell and is necessary

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. The endothelial cell layer is a single layer of polygonal epithelial cells. Option: B. The cell density is around 3000 cells/mm2 in young adults. The count is around 5000-6000 at birth. Option: C. The loss of cells with age is compensated with the enlargement of cells and the migration of neighbouring cells.

questions.text: Which of the following is the long-term corneal preservation method?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Cryopreservation method Cryopreservation of the corneal button at -70 degree can be done for up to 1 year. Other long term methods include glycerine preservation and the organ culture method.

Highyeild:

Methods of corneal preservation Short-term storage (24 hours to 96 hours) methods include: Mais/ chamber method . The whole globe after enucleation can be preserved in a moist chamber at 4 °C in a refrigerator for up to 24 hours. McCarey Kaufman (M-K) medium. It is of pink colour and comprises: tissue culture (TC) - 199, 5%, Dextran-40, HEPES buffer (to adjust pH at 7.4), and gentamicin 0.1 mg/mL. Donor corneo-scleral rims can be preserved in the M-K medium for up to 96 hours. It is the most commonly used method in India and around the world over. Intermediate-term storage (up to 2 weeks) of the donor corneo-scleral rim can be done in storage media such as Optisol GS (most commonly used preservative medium in the USA) . It comprises 2.5% chondroitin sulphate, l % dextran, ascorbic acid, vitamin 812, ATP precursors, and the antibiotics gentamicin and streptomycin. Other similar media for intermediate storage available are Cornisol, Eusol, and Life-GE medium. Long-term preservation (up to months to years) methods include: Glycerine preservation can be done for 3-4 weeks. The organ culture method at 30°C to 37°c is useful for preservation up to 35 days. Cryopreservation of corneal buttons at -70°C can be done for up to l years.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. McCarey kaufman medium is pink -coloured. Contains tissue culture, dextran 5%, HEPES buffer, and gentamicin 0.1 mg/ml. The cornea can be preserved for up to 96 hours. Option: C. Optisol GS medium comprises 2.5% chondroitin sulphate, 1% dextran, ascorbic acid, vitaminB12, ATP precursors, and gentamicin, and streptomycin. Option: D. moist chamber method: whole globe can be preserved at 4°C in a refrigerator up to 24 hours.

Extraedge:

There are two potential sources of cell damage during cryopreservation : formation of large ice crystals inside the cell. Intracellular concentrations of solutes increase to toxic levels before or during freezing as a result of dehydration. Cryoprotectants act like antifreeze , they lower freezing temperatures and increase viscosity.

questions.text: Which of the following is beneficial for the patient? Suffering from gyrate atrophy of the choroid due to a deficiency of the enzyme ornithine transcarbomylase?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Arginine free diet Gyrate atrophy of the choroid and the retina is a rare autosomal recessive retinal dystrophy characterized by progressive chorioretinal degeneration , early cataract formation, and myopia. It is caused by a deficiency in the enzyme ornithine aminotransferase (OAT) , which results in a 10- to 20-fold increase in plasma ornithine concentrations.

Highyeild:

Patients classically present in the first decade of life with nyctalopia , with a fundus exam revealing characteristic circular patches of chorioretinal atrophy distributed in the peripheral fundus.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Ornithine-Free Diet Is Not Appropriate Option. Option: C. B1, B6, And B12 Supplementation Is Not Appropriate Option. Option: D. Folic acid and pyridoxine is not appropriate option.

Extraedge:

As the disease progresses, the atrophic lesions coalesce and advance centripetally towards the posterior pole, correlating with the progressive loss of peripheral vision . Macular involvement occurs late in the disease.

Solution:

Ring of Schwalbe The cornea is composed of 5 discrete anatomical components , each with specific functions to achieve the goal of clarity and refractive potential. The outermost component , the epithelium, provides a smooth surface due to the interactions of cytoskeletal components and the tear film matrix. It also serves an important protective barrier function . The Bowman layer or membrane , the second layer, moving in towards the eye, serves as the smooth adhesion layer for the basement membrane of the epithelial cells. This layer is not crucial for clarity or visual function since removal of the Bowman layer during photorefractive keratectomy does not negatively affect vision. Termination of descemet membrane is Schwalbe's line.

Highyeild:

The corneal stroma makes up the majority of the width of the cornea. It is composed of collagen fibrils arranged in a regular pattern to allow light to enter and pass through without being diffracted or reflected. Inflammation manifesting as stromal infiltrates and/or stromal edoema results in the interruption of the regular periodicity of the collagen matrix and decreased corneal clarity. Because the cornea is avascular, nutrients and wastes are delivered and deposited anteriorly via the tear film and external environment, internally via corneal nerves, and posteriorly via the aqueous humour. Anatomy of angle of anterior chamber

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option A, B and C are not correct option.

Extraedge:

The innermost layer of the cornea is the endothelial cell layer, a monolayer of polarized cells . They are arranged with their apical portion toward the aqueous humor in the anterior chamber. The endothelial cells are responsible for maintaining the desiccation of the stroma by actively removing water.

questions.text: Identify the ocular sign as shown in the Image
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Buphthalmos In this condition, IOP is raised and the eyeball is enlarged as a whole. The enlarged cornea is usually associated with central or peripheral clouding and Descemet's tears (Haab's striae).

Highyeild:

Congenital glaucoma Congenital glaucoma occurs in about 1 in 10,000 births, and is defined as glaucoma appearing between birth and the ages of 3–4 years. Up to this age,the eye wall is distensible, so that the eye can noticeably and progressively enlarge when the intraocular pressure is elevated. Clinical features Lacrimation, photophobia, and blepharospasm often form the classic triad of symptoms of congenital glaucoma. Corneal signs . Corneal signs include its oedema, enlargement, and Descemet’s breaks. Corneal oedema. It is the first sign Of corneal enlargement. It occurs along with an enlargement of globe-buphthalmos and is usually seen in children less than 3 years of age. Normal infant cornea measures 5 mm. A diameter of more than 13 mm confirms enlargement. Tears and breaks in Descemet’s membrane (Haab’s striae). The sclera becomes thin and appears blue due to underlying uveal tissue. The anterior chamber becomes deep. Iris may show iridodonesis and atrophic patches in late stage. The lens becomes flat due to the stretching of zonules and may even subluxate backward. The optic disc may show variable cupping and atrophy. IOP is raised, but not acutely. Axial myopia may occur because of increase in axial length which may give rise to anisometropic. Investigation- Measurement of IOP with Schiotz or Perkin’s applanation tonometer since scleral rigidity is very low in children Measurement of corneal diameter by callipers . Slit-lamp examination should be carried out with a portable slit-lamp. Ophthalmoscopy to evaluate the optic disc. A gonioscopic examination of the angle of the anterior chamber reveals it to be either flat or concave. Treatment Drugs like CA inhibitors and beta blockers Surgical management. Trabeculotomy + trabeculectomy is TOC Trabeculotomy is the 2nd TOC Goniotomy- is TOC for clear cornea

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Exophthalmos: the term exophthalmos is particularly used for the displacement associated with thyroid eye disease . Option: C. Staphyloma: Staphyloma refers to a localised bulging of the weak and thin outer tunic of the eyeball (cornea or sclera), lined by uveal tissu es which shines through the thinned -out fibrous coat. Option: D. . Is not appropriate option.

questions.text: A 30-year-old patient has presented to you with a corneal epithelial defect. Which of the following modalities are ideal treatment strategies? Gundersen flap Amniotic membrane patch grafting Cyanoacrylate glue Limbal stem cell transplantation Smoking cessation Select the correct answer from the given below code:

options.label: B
options.text: a, b, c, d and e

questions.correct_answer: B. a, b, c, d and e
questions.explanation:
Solution:

a, b, c, d and e A conjunctival (Gundersen) flap will protect and allow healing of a corneal epithelial defect . It is particularly suitable for chronic unilateral disease, in which the prognosis for restoration of useful vision is poor. The buccal mucous membrane is an alternative. Amniotic membrane patch grafting can be used for persistent, unresponsive epithelial defects. Tissue adhesive like cyanoacrylate glue is used to seal small perforations. The glue can be applied to one side of a bespoke, trimmed patch of sterile plastic drape, which is pressed over the defect after the edges are dried with a cellulose sponge . The patch remains in place to seal the defect, and a bandage contact lens is inserted for comfort and to aid retention of the patch. Limbal stem cell transplantation may be used if there is a stem cell deficiency, as in chemical burns and cicatrizing conjunctivitis. The source of the donor tissue may be the fellow eye (autograft) in unilateral disease or a living or cadaver donor (allograft) when both eyes are affected. A newer technique involves the in vitro replication of the patient's own stem cells with subsequent reimplantation of the enhanced cell population. Smoking retards epithelialization and should be discontinued.

Highyeild:

Before considering any of the above-mentioned treatment modalities, it is important to first prevent infection from progressing. Later, on the required modality can be adapted.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A, C and D. Rest all options are incorrect.

questions.text: A patient came in with a suspected corneal epithelial defect. After a thorough exam, you have to document these findings. Match clinical corneal findings to their respective colour coding. Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

A-3, B-5, C-1, D-2, E-4 Clinical signs should be illustrated with a color-coded, labelled diagram. Measuring lesion dimensions is particularly useful to facilitate monitoring. Slit lamp photography is an increasingly supplement or alternative, but it must be of high quality. The documentation is indicated in the image below.

Highyeild:

Opacities such as scars and degenerations are drawn in black Hypopyon is shown in yellow. Epithelial oedema is represented by fine blue circles, stromal oedema as blue shading, and folds in the Descemet membrane as wavy blue lines, Blood vessels are added in red. Superficial vessels are wavy lines that begin outside the limbus, and deep vessels are straight lines that begin at the limbus. Pigmented lesions such as iron lines and Krukenberg spindles are shown in brown.

Random:

Explanation for all options: - Option: A. Opacities such as scars and degenerations are drawn in black. Option: B. Hypopyon is shown in yellow. Option: C. Epithelial oedema is represented by fine blue circles, stromal oedema as blue shading, and folds in the Descemet membrane as wavy blue lines. Option: D. Blood vessels are added in red. Superficial vessels are wavy lines that begin outside the limbus and deep vessels are straight lines that begin at the limbus. Option: E. Pigmented lesions such as iron lines and Krukenberg spindles are shown in brown.
